org.ehcache.core.spi.time

Class TickingTimeSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ehcache.core.spi.time.TickingTimeSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TimeSource, Service

    public class TickingTimeSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimeSource, Service
    A TimeSource that increases the time in background using a timer. This time usually gives better performances to Ehcache than the default SystemTimeSource. However, it will create a background thread that will continuously wake up to update the time.

    It works be increasing the time at a given granularity. So if you set the granularity at 10ms, a timer is called every 10ms and will increase the current time of 10ms. This will cause the current time to diverge a bit from the system time after a while. So you specify a system update period where the current time will be reset to the system time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TickingTimeSource

        public TickingTimeSource(long granularity,
                         long systemUpdatePeriod)
        Constructor to create a ticking time source.
        Parameters:
        granularity - how long in milliseconds between each timer call to increment the current time
        systemUpdatePeriod - how long between resets of the current time to system time
